title: Java Networking Basics
subject: Java
theory:
Connecting two nodes.

*   **Socket**: Endpoint for communication.
*   **ServerSocket**: Listens for incoming connections.
*   **InetAddress**: IP Address representation.
syntax:
ServerSocket ss = new ServerSocket(6666);
Socket s = ss.accept(); // waits for client

examples.code:
URL url = new URL("http://google.com");
URLConnection urlcon = url.openConnection();

common_mistakes.mistake: Running blocking network on UI thread
common_mistakes.correction: Freezes app. Always use worker threads for networking.

real_world_use_cases.description: Socket connection stays open to receive messages instantly.

exam_notes: TCP is reliable, UDP is fast.
